name: MoodTunes
description: An AI-powered music recommendation app that creates personalized playlists based on your current mood, activities, and preferences
goal: To help music lovers discover the perfect soundtrack for any moment, reducing decision fatigue and enhancing their daily experiences through personalized music

tools.name: Problem Definition
tools.content: Music lovers spend too much time searching for the right songs that match their current mood, activity, or environment. Existing music apps provide generic recommendations that don't adapt to the user's immediate context, leading to decision fatigue and a disconnected listening experience.

segments.name: Busy Professionals
segments.description: 25-40 year olds who use music to enhance productivity and mood throughout their day
segments.needs: Quick access to appropriate music without disrupting workflow
segments.pain_points: Decision fatigue, time wasted searching for the right playlist

segments.name: Fitness Enthusiasts
segments.description: People who regularly work out and use music to enhance their exercise
segments.needs: Dynamic playlists that match workout intensity and type
segments.pain_points: Having to manually switch playlists during different workout phases

segments.name: Casual Listeners
segments.description: People who enjoy music throughout their day but aren't audiophiles
segments.needs: Easy discovery of new music that matches their taste and current activity
segments.pain_points: Overwhelmed by choices, stuck in musical ruts

assumptions.statement: Users are willing to share contextual data (activity, location) to get better music recommendations
assumptions.evidence: 7/10 interviewees expressed comfort sharing this data if they understand the benefits

assumptions.statement: Users will pay a small monthly fee for mood-based music recommendations
assumptions.validation_method: Landing page with pricing, competitor analysis

assumptions.statement: We can accurately determine user mood through a combination of user input and contextual data

tools.name: Interview Plan
key_findings: 9/12 users report spending 5+ minutes finding the right music for different situations
Most users (10/12) rely on saved playlists rather than exploring new music
Privacy concerns exist but are outweighed by convenience for most users
Integration with existing music services is highly desired (mentioned by all users)

ideas.title: Mood Input Interface
ideas.description: Simple emoji-based interface for quick mood selection, combined with contextual awareness

ideas.title: Activity Detection
ideas.description: Use phone sensors to detect activities (running, walking, sitting) for better recommendations

ideas.title: Social Mood Sharing
ideas.description: Allow friends to share moods and corresponding playlists

research.title: Music Streaming Market Analysis
research.summary: The global music streaming market is growing at 16% CAGR, with increasing demand for personalized experiences

research.title: Competitor Analysis
research.summary: Examined 5 major music apps and their recommendation approaches. None offer real-time mood and context matching

feedback.quote: I waste so much time creating different playlists for different workout phases. If your app could automatically transition as my workout intensity changes, that would be amazing.
I use different music for coding versus meetings versus breaks. Having to manually switch is annoying and breaks my flow.

inspirations: Spotify's Discover Weekly but for moods and moments
How fitness apps adapt to user activity and progress

next_steps: Complete assumption validation through landing page test
Build functional prototype focusing on the mood input interface
Develop technical POC for the recommendation algorithm
Explore partnerships with music streaming services

key_challenges: Accurate mood detection from limited input
